instructions: Remove all metal objects including jewellery, piercings, hairpins, and hearing aids before the scan.
Inform the technician if you have any metal implants, pacemakers, or surgical clips.
You may eat and drink normally before a brain MRI unless instructed otherwise.
Wear comfortable, loose-fitting clothing with no metal zippers or buttons.
Inform your technician if you are claustrophobic — sedation options are available.
Arrive 15 minutes early to complete paperwork.

Wear loose, comfortable shorts if possible, or you will be provided a gown.
You may eat and drink normally before a knee MRI.

instructions: Remove all metal objects including jewellery, belts, and underwire bras.
Inform the technician of any spinal hardware, rods, or surgical implants.
You may eat and drink normally unless contrast dye is being used.
If contrast dye is required, fast for 4 hours before the scan.
Wear comfortable clothing with no metal fastenings.
Arrive 15 minutes early; if contrast is ordered, arrive 30 minutes early.
contraindications: Metal implants near the spine (requires pre-scan verification)

instructions: Remove all metal objects before entering the MRI suite.
Inform staff of any implants, surgical hardware, or metal fragments in your body.
Wear comfortable, loose-fitting clothing.
Follow any specific fasting instructions provided by your referring physician.
Arrive 15 minutes before your scheduled time.
Inform staff if you are pregnant or may be pregnant.
contraindications: Certain metallic implants — always disclose your full medical history
